intro: Octomeria ochroleuca var. trilobata, commonly known as the yellow-leaf octomeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
